raw_text:
Ray DVD beats box office takings
 
 Oscar-nominated film biopic Ray has surpassed its US box office takings with a combined tally of $80m (£43m) from DVD and video sales and rentals.
 
 Ray's success on DVD outstripped its $74m (£40m) US box office total, earning more than $40m (£22m) on the first day of the DVD's release alone. Ray has been nominated in six Oscar categories including best film and best actor for Jamie Foxx. The film recounts the life of blues singer Ray Charles, who died in 2004. In its first week on home entertainment release the film was the number one selling DVD, with the limited edition version coming in at number 11. Sony horror film The Grudge, starring Michelle Gellar, was the US' second best-selling DVD, with Jennifer Lopez and Richard Gere's romantic comedy Shall We Dance? at number three. Foxx's critically acclaimed performance as Ray has already earned him a Screen Actors Guild Award for best actor, as well as a prestigious Golden Globe. Ray director Taylor Hackford, responsible for the classic 1982 film An Officer and a Gentleman, has also received an Oscar nomination in the best director category. The film's three other Oscar nominations are for costume, film editing and sound mixing.
llama3.2:1b: Ray DVD beats box office takings with $80m (£43m) from sales and rentals, surpassing its US total of $74m by more than $6m.
Ray earned $40m on the first day of release alone.
The film was a best-seller in its first week, peaking at number one on DVD sales, while Sony's The Grudge and Jennifer Lopez and Richard Gere's Shall We Dance?

Film earned Jamie Foxx an Oscar nomination for best actor and received six nominations in total, including best director for Taylor Hackford.

Jamie Foxx's performance earned him an award and the film is nominated for several Oscars.

The film's limited edition version came in at number 11 first week, while The Grudge was the second-best selling DVD with number 13.
Michelle Gellar, Jennifer Lopez and Richard Gere were also praised by critics.
Foxx’s performance as Ray has already earned him a Screen Actors Guild Award for best actor and a Golden Globe nomination.

The film's success outpaces its box office, with Foxx earning a Screen Actors Guild Award for best actor.
It was number one in its first week of home entertainment release, with Sony's Grudge and Lopez/Gere's Shall We Dance?
at second and third place respectively.
The film received three Oscar nominations including costume design, sound mixing, and editing.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Ray DVD surpassed its US box office takings at $80 million ($43 million pounds) from combined DVD and video sales.
On its first day alone, it earned over $40 million ($22 million pounds), surpassing the total of $74 million ($40 million pounds) that its US box office had surpassed earlier.
The film recounted the life of blues singer Ray Charles, featuring Jamie Foxx's critically acclaimed performance, which earned him a Screen Actors Guild Award as well as several other awards.

tinyllama:1.1b: Ray, the Oscar-nominated film biopic that tells the life of blue singer Ray Charles, has reclaimed its US box office taking, earning over $80m in sales on DVDs alone and topping the charts with a combined total of $40m.
The film was also nominated for six Academy Awards, including best film and best actor for Jamie Foxx, who won in the best actor category.
The film's critical acclaim has already earned it nominations for the Screen Actors Guild Award for best actor and a Golden Globe for best motion picture drama.
In its first week on home entertainment release, Ray held off a competitive field of films such as horror thriller The Grugne and romantic comedy Shall We Dance?
from actress Jennifer Lopez and Richard Gere respectively, to take the number one spot in the DVD sales charts, with Foxx's critical performance as Ray earning him an Oscar nomination for best actor.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Prepare for the next round of predictions: In the highly anticipated sequel to 2017's hit horror film Shall We Dance?
(Sony), which saw Jennifer Lopez and Richard Gere romantically team up, Michelle Gellar's character Ray Charles is set to star in a new movie that reimagines the iconic blues singer's life.

The movie, known as Ray, is slated for release on DVD, with a potential $40 million opening weekend, and will be followed by a 14-city limited engagement before being released nationally on February 7th, 2020.
This follow-up film showcases Ray's life in the years following his death, capturing the emotional highs and lows of his journey while also exploring the impact of his music on society.

The film also received nominations in costume design, film editing, and sound mixing categories.

The film made over $40 million on its first day of DVD release and was the top-selling DVD in its first week.

Ray, a biopic about blues singer Ray Charles, has six Oscar nominations, including Best Film and Best Actor for Jamie Foxx, who has already won a Screen Actors Guild Award and a Golden Globe for his performance.
Director Taylor Hackford is also nominated for Best Director.
